title: WWII American Propaganda Poster Fonts
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437im_/http:/typophile.com/files/I'm%20Counting%20On%20You!_5532.jpg)

I am looking for either of the italicized fonts in these posters most importantly, but if any one know either of the non-italicized fonts that would also be brilliant :) Thank you in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437im_/http:/typophile.com/files/I%20Gave%20a%20Man_4455.png)

comments.content:
More generally, some interesting resources by Walden Fonts Co.: [American Poster Fonts of the World War II](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.waldenfont.com/product.asp?productid=16)

First poster  
I'M COUNTING ON YOU/DON'T DISCUSS: [Eckhart Freehand JNL](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/eckhardt-freehand), [Balloon](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/balloon), [Flash](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/flash), [Challenge](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/challenge), [Totally Awesome](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/totally-awesome), [Nelda](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.waldenfont.com/product.asp?productid=16)  
TROOP MOVEMENTS - SHIP SAILINGS - WAR EQUIPMENT: probably go with [Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica) Condensed Black; from Walden Fonts, [Eldon](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.waldenfont.com/product.asp?productid=16);

Second poster  
I GAVE A MAN!: [Tasty](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hubertjocham/tasty) and again [Flash](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/flash), [Challenge](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/challenge) and [Nelda](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.waldenfont.com/product.asp?productid=16)  
Will you give at least (10%) of your pay in War Bonds?: easiest way would probably [Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/futura); from WF, [Payson](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.waldenfont.com/product.asp?productid=16) and [Odon](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.waldenfont.com/product.asp?productid=16); [Mostra Nuova](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra-nuova) might work also pretty well coming even closer for digits;

I'M COUNTING ON YOU/DON'T DISCUSS: Also EckhartSpeedletterJNL [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/eckhardt-speedletter/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/eckhardt-speedletter/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/eckhardt-speedletter/")  
Okay [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/okay/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/okay/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/okay/") [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/okay/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/okay/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/okay/")  
Salsbury [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/salsbury/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/salsbury/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/salsbury/")  
Don

Hi Ryuk, I assume your reference to Welda is actually to Nelda WF.  
Don

I GAVE A MAN! The scripts we have suggested so far lack the tone of the anguished and explosive cry for help of this lettering. Note the sharp corners. As a substitute I would use BiffBamBoom by Comicraft [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/biff-bam-boom/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/biff-bam-boom/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/comicraft/biff-bam-boom/") The lettering is very successful because it expresses the vigor shown in BiffBamBoom within the frame work of a less staccato treatment of the tops and bottoms of letters. A good project for a font maker.  
Somewha similar idea with Piekos FX [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/blambot/piekos-fx-bb/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194437/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/blambot/piekos-fx-bb/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/blambot/piekos-fx-bb/")  
Don
